website_summaries.verdict: A trusted brand delivers non-toxic products that know how to perform.
pros: Stainless steel cookware does not discolor
Engineered for serious chefs who desire to cook faster and more evenly

website_summaries.verdict: Professional-grade stainless steel cookware designed for experienced home cooks and commercial users. We love the even heating of the stainless steel and the curved lips for easy pouring.
pros: Tri-ply stainless and aluminum construction provides even heating
Requires less heat to reach cooking temps
cons: Some customers not impressed with lids

website_summaries.verdict: Create professional-quality dishes with consistent heating in this 12-piece stainless steel set.
pros: Ideal for home chefs with a knack for whipping up impressive cuisine without spending thousands on cookware
Great for daily use as well
We especially love its ease of use for those new to cooking
cons: Cleans easily but may scratch at times

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Set and even worse Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This set is terrible. I used the large skillet once and it's almost as if the coating has worn off and now it's this horrible white residue (see photo) that won't come off. Even worse, I contacted Cuisinart and they gave me an email address to send my complaint to and it's been over two weeks and I haven't heard anything back. It's one thing to have a terrible product but the customer service is even worse and I will never buy any of their products ever again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Skillets Warped After A Few Uses
customer_reviews.text: Both skillets warped after just a couple of uses, although I followed the use and car instructions to the letter. The both wobble on the cooktop surface, and as a result no longer heat evenly. This issue appears to be widespread, based on other reviews. Extremely disappointed given the price. Also, the warranty replacement appears to be more time-consuming and costly than buying a different brand of skillets. Last time I buy Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: CA472

customer_reviews.title: “New” set arrived heavily used & rusted.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this set for my new apartment. The box looked nice enough when it arrived. However, upon opening the set, it became clear that the set had been used before (even though I most definitely ordered it NEW) and there is substantial residue/rust on several of the items, including the largest pot. See photos. What a disgusting experience and a huge waste of money. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: kaimbanks

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely excited for this product however I can only assume they repackage and resell returned items because one pot was wrapped up yet had scratches all around the inside. A few others had minor scratches. And the box containing the pots had been ripped slightly giving me the assumption that it was previously opened. Not happy with the hassle of returning what I should have received as new and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Tayla

customer_reviews.title: 10 inch skillet warped
customer_reviews.text: I have a horrible electric stovetop in my apartment. I kept blaming it for such uneven heating until I realized the bottom of the 10 inch skillet is bowed out nearly a quarter of an inch when the pan is pre-heated. Cuisinart is trash.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Walking on egg shells, pretty pots, no thanks
customer_reviews.text: Brown stains on pots at first two attempts cooking on my electric range. Stains wouldn't come out. I followed the very, very delicate manufacturer instructions for each. Even tried some online tips to no avail. I'm 50+ and assure you this was not my first rodeo. I'm a good cook and prefer to focus on cooking, not delicate pots. Exchanged these for Cuisinart's hard anod aluminum set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loud buzzing and vibrating with my induction stove top.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy pots and pans. Great feel and heat control. I have cooked several meals on these already. Big negative, on our induction range, they make a lot of noise (buzzing and vibrating). Never had another pan make such annoying sound, seems to only be on our highest heat settings. Once you bring it down to only 80% or less power, it mostly subsides. I assume its the metal cladding? You can see the internal cladding from where the water boils. Video attached.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Gere

customer_reviews.title: High hopes dashed!
customer_reviews.text: The set I received was obviously used and then returned. The set seems well assembled and is very heavy. It contains most of the pots and pans you would need to outfit a kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: High hopes but very Disappointed after use.
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with the product. I have just used it once on medium flame and seems the stainless coating comes out . The upper coating is not very durable and of not very good quality. Pics attached. Please refrain from buying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... this as 3 stars only because I am not happy with Cuisinart's Customer Service position for replacing missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I am rating this as 3 stars only because I am not happy with Cuisinart's Customer Service position for replacing missing parts. I ordered a 12 piece Multiclad Pro cookware set. It arrived in original packaging but included (2) 3 qt. sauce pan lids in lieu of (1) 3 qt and (1) 1.5 qt lid. I asked Cuisinart to send me the correct lid but they refused instructing me to return the entire set to the seller OR purchase the correct lid for $33. As for the cookware set, It is very nice and performs beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: salthouse

customer_reviews.title: These are 10x Worse than $15 Wal Mart pans
customer_reviews.text: If you love EVERYTHING sticking to your pots when cooking buy these!! You literally can’t even cook eggs on these without the whole bottom of the pan being covered with stuck on eggs. The only thing they’re good for is looks. Not cooking!!
customer_reviews.author: Zubin

customer_reviews.title: Terrible experience
customer_reviews.text: Its beautiful but after literally washing and drying it by hand one time, it tarnished. The next few times I used them, every thing stuck to the bottom. I didn't expect it to be non-stick but I also didn't expect to use 2-3 times more oil to prevent sticking. I ended up purchasing a wok style pan and use it for everything without a hitch. It was less than $50 including tax. This set was such a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sinister pots and pans leave cuts on thumbs and fingers, sadly.
customer_reviews.text: The rims on these pots and pans are so sharp. I wish I would’ve had the chance to experience them longer before my return window closed. My husband and myself (as has my mother when she’s visited and helps out by washing dishes sometimes) we’ve experienced getting cuts often whenever we sponge/scrub around the rim. Whenever we hug the sponge onto the rim and drive it around to scrub it, we’ll end up getting a cut on our thumb or fingers if it’s exposed and slides onto the rim. Is it a defective product that I received?? I’m not sure, but I’m leaving a review here to see if it’s happened to others as it has with us?
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Bohls

customer_reviews.title: Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: These pots and pans are awesome when cooking and cleaning I absolutely love them but the reason I give a 3 star over all. They can be dangerous. The edges are so sharp I have cut my knuckles and fingers multiple times washing them and even moving them. Pisses me off that they are so sharp on the edges. They should have rolled edge or something to not be so I’ll cut you sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Dostal

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY Pots you'll ever need to buy.
customer_reviews.text: Spend the money on these pots once, and never buy pots again. These things are amazing. Bullet proof! Keep them clean with Bar Keepers Friend and Jet Scrubberz and you'll never have an issue. They warm well, distribute heat great, and look great on my stove. If you're used to non-stick, there is a learning curve, but just add butter or oil, otherwise you'll be burning. HIGHLY recommended. Do yourself a favor and buy these so you don't have to spend money on pots again. Very good weight and all work well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Discolored...Insta-Brown!
customer_reviews.text: After the first use these pans went from a beautiful new looking stainless appearance to a permanent worn brown stained and discolored appeared. Kind of sucks, cause it looks they aged a decade after a single use. Other than that they seem well balanced, good solid weight to them, and decent quality. Just hate these things got so discolored so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Biolizard

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: I just used these for the first time - my first time using stainless steel. I followed internet advice and heated the pan empty first, then added ghee, then added the pork chops. I got an amazing sear and nothing stuck to the pan. I easily made pan sauce as well. No issues. The pan came completely clean with a sponge and hot soapy water. I also used the pot with the steamer insert to steam green beans with garlic and it worked perfectly. My only regret is using non-stick pans for so long. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Normal Norma

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy these for a “healthier” “less toxic” option without breaking the bank but I ended up wasting $200 Everything sticks even on low or medium Nothing gets cooked evenly Everything takes forever to cool but yet is burning at the same time Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Desi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing - non stick once seasoned
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to say anyone who says these burn are using them wrong! I’m a newbie and seasoned the fry pans. I literally just made eggs with ZERO added fat. (The photo added was my first try - i added butter. This time i left it off because i didn’t think it was needed). No butter and no oil. Just season your pans and don’t cook above medium heat! They are excellent at holding and maintaining heat quickly/efficiently. I love them - worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed at the quality of this product. I thought I had done my research and was getting a hit quality product. Instead the food sticks to the pots and pans, regardless of how much oil I put in them to prevent sticking. It is frustrating to clean-I need to soak the pot or pan in hot water before cleaning and then I have to scrub to remove stuck on food. Still it has left residue and discoloration of the pots and pans. Very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Awful set!
customer_reviews.text: Worst cookware set that we’ve EVER owned. We love Cuisinart, and have many Cuisinart appliances and kitchen items, but I’m so disappointed with this set. Everything that we try to cook sticks no matter how much butter or oil we use. We even looked up how to videos on how we could season the set to prevent sticking. Unfortunately, we’re about a week past the return date. I wanted to love this set based on other reviews but I hate it. I should have returned it after only using a few times, but I thought that It’s get better with use..nope! I would never recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heat fast and evenly, but warp easily as well
customer_reviews.text: These pans heat very quickly and evenly, even in low settings. They clean up as well as can be expected for stainless. The 10" skillet warped within the first 2 uses, even with care taken to avoid any temperature shocking. I'm submitting a warranty claim now, but I am frustrated with the prospect of paying twice for shipping for a product which became defective so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: The handles do get HOT
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a gas stove and my old pots and pans could not be used. After reading previous reviews, I decided to purchase this set. I may have misread the other reviews and descriptions of this set of pots and pans as I thought it said the handles did not get hot. However, they most certainly do get HOT! That being said, I do like this set. So far they have been very easy to clean and the heat distributes evenly. Would buy again, in fact, I'm looking to add to this set.
customer_reviews.author: Choptank Gram

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst pots and pans. They lost their non stick finish after just 1 use and we didn’t use any abrasives nor did I let the foods overcook, or leave it on the hot burner empty. So now no matter how much oil or butter you use, everything sticks, even pasta stuck that was boiling in water!! Very frustrating since I thought they would be a wonderful set and are very beautiful but crap for the price you pay for them. So essentially we bought our old reliable, hard anodized set and want to throw these away.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa P.

customer_reviews.title: Not what they say it is !!!
customer_reviews.text: Everything sticks to them when cooking except money. I wish it would have at least the amount I paid for them stick to the bottom. The wife was majorly disappointed when she used them and to think she was so happy I bought them for her, she would finally have good pots and pans to cook with. NOT!!! Heck I haven't eaten a good meal sense she cooked with them for the first and last time and she is a great cook. Keep looking for a good set and if you find one let me know before I fade away.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K Holeva

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: Revising my earlier review. These a really not very good pans. They clean up horribly (virtually anything you cook will require vigorous scrubbing to remove, EVEN BOILED FOODS, like pasta, poached eggs, etc!), the handles are surprisingly uncomfortable in the hand and they get very, very hot, even when cooking at low heat. Unfortunately I have already passed the window for returns. Pennywise, pound foolish - I really wish I had just put the $200 I spent on these towards an All-Clad set. Hopefully other buyers will not make my same mistake.
customer_reviews.author: jmt

customer_reviews.title: very pretty!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 problems with this purchase: 1) The tops are not see thru, there are a lot of them and hard to store. 2) The pots and pans are "heavy", I'm sure they are top quality however their weight makes them difficult to use. I'm seriously considering this a mistake and getting rid of this problem I bought. They cook "hot" compared to my other P&P's, not very much good to say about them BUT they are pretty!
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Valley

customer_reviews.title: My advice? Go Teflon or cast iron . Steel clad not great.
customer_reviews.text: Good set. Visually appealing. Very heavy. Seems well made. I will say I'd rather have a cast iron pan to cook in rather than these. Unless u cook all ur food floating in oil...it's gonna stick. No big deal, but if u have a cast iron pan it's substantialy less sticky than these and u get iron in ur food. If I were to buy again I'd get the small pan with the steamer addon and lid only. A Cast iron skillet is better than the steel clad, so not 5 stars. I would think most would prefer Teflon something or other.
customer_reviews.author: branden

customer_reviews.title: Pan the Pans
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as the best pots and pans for a glasstop electric range, but after using them for nearly a year, I wouldn't recommend them for the single reason that everything I cook in the frying pans - small, medium and large - stick. I've sauted and fryed using various heat settings, butter, oil and Pam, but still food items stick. Requires soaking the pans before they can be cleaned. Additionally, these pans are HEAVY. These are going to Goodwill. Time to get a new non-stick set.
customer_reviews.author: Rick J. Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Stained the first time I used it.  Would not recomment.
customer_reviews.text: Based on the many positive reviews I was so excited to get my new Cuisinart Stainless Steel Cookware Set. We followed the directions and cooked at a low to medium temperature and our saute pans stained the very first time we used them. I am returning them and going to try another brand of pans. Very disappointed. We tried to remove the stains with no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Everything STICKS!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried everything from seasoning the pan to frying green onions (suggestion from youtube) in hopes to build a non stick layer - no luck. Nothing works. Everything sticks. I don't know how people cook in this stainless steel pan without it sticking - must be a miracle. Or I just received a bad batch. Not to mention it's a pain to clean; doesn't matter if it's a saucepan or a 8/10-inch pan - everything sticks. I made oatmeal in the saucepan - that too, stuck. Not enjoying the stainless steel experience and wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Ladies and gents, that picture is from THE VERY FIRST USE. Washed the pan before use, used low heat, you name it. These pans are AWFUL. We have natural gas stove. I would definitely not buy these pans if you have gas stove/oven. I can also go ahead and tell, you will not be able to cook back to back or have multiple types of food in the pan. It simply won’t work well. You will need to wash the pan the very second you finish cooking. This is incredibly disappointing. You spend a decent amount of money for supposedly good quality pans, but they are unusable. You’ve been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NON STICK? or STICK
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to have this new set of cookware as I was moving into my new apartment with newly renovated kitchen. The first day it arrives, I took it out, tried cooking sunny side up egg, expecting it to be nice and pretty since it's supposed to be non stick. HOWEVER, The egg stick to the whole pan even though I used oil, and literally only got the top yolk part out of it. I tried to cook other food too but everything sticks on this pan. Looking at other reviews I'm thinking did I get a wrong product because I don't know how people give good reviews to these things. Pots are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Han

customer_reviews.title: IMPRESSED
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same set for my son and his family. They LOVE cooking with it, so I bought myself a set and I too enjoy cooking with these pots/pans. Much better than coated type cookware, EXCEPT when it comes to making eggs. I don't know if it is ME, or the pan, but I have runied too many over easy eggs with this cookware due to sticking((regardless if I use oil or spray)). So I ONLY use non-stick pan for eggs. Everything else we use this cookware. I HIGHLY recommend this product and I also think the cost is worth it too.((not too expensive or cheap for what you get)).
customer_reviews.author: Tina Marie Bailey

customer_reviews.title: I want to love these pans...
customer_reviews.text: I want to love these pans, but find it very hard to do so. I like to cook and am in no ways a professional check; however, I can navigate my way around a kitchen fairly well. My biggest complaint is food sticking. Unless I add a lot of oil or butter, my food sticks and burns. Even the sauce pans I have a problem with there being a constant ring around the inside or food cooking to the bottom. The reason I bought these was because there were so many glowing reviews. Wish one of those reviews was me. Sorry- but I would have to say - not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: JMA Rickey

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and value
customer_reviews.text: I have used all clad in the past and this set, so far, seems it's equal in every way. Clean up has been great with a little bar keepers friend needed occasionally. Heats and cooks super evenly on our gas range. I really like the flared rims a lot better than the straight sides on the All Clad. My only complaint at all is that I would have liked a larger frying pan, but that just gives me the excuse to get a carbon steel one...
customer_reviews.author: Eric Youngberg

customer_reviews.title: Not completely stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: I’ve waited and researched for the best cookware for the buck and decided on this set based on reviews. Initially I thought this was a beautiful set. Heavier than expected but good quality. Beautiful luster and shine, however, I cooked a bologna with sauerkraut in the larger saucepan and to my horror, it tarnished the bottom of the cover and parts of the saucepan! I used the recommended kitchen cleaner with a sis pad and some but not all came out. The outside pan is stainless steel but the covers and inside pans are not. Used a magnet to prove it. Just be ware of using acidic foods when cooking.
customer_reviews.author: picco24

customer_reviews.title: Make cooking great again!
customer_reviews.text: I spent an embarrassing amount of time researching pans. I knew early on the I wanted a multi ply configuration and examined everything from allclad to tfal. I'm glad I chose the Cuisinart MCD. These are a huge departure from you run of the mil pan set. The quality is outstanding especially given the price point. The 7pc gives you the most important pieces. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M

customer_reviews.title: Handles get HOT
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this set. As beautiful, versatile, and comparatively lightweight as the pieces are, it's a HUGE inconvenience that both the pot and lid handles get hot. I now understand why this set is so cheap. I don't really want to adjust to having to deal with hot handles so I think I might have to return this set. Update: I decided to keep the set since I was unable to find another that I liked as much. Although the hot handles and lids have been inconvenience, overall I'm satisfied. I've had the set for a few months and will note that the rivets corrode easily but that's to be expected at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: I've used these for two years
customer_reviews.text: They are great pans, they held up super nice over the past two years and look and work great. But... I hate that all food sticks to them so badly. I think this might be a feature of stainless steel pans. I end up using a LOT more oil and butter on my food. Otherwise it will fuse with the bottom of the pan. I just bought two expensive nonstick pans.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Kessell

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous pans
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these. To those that say they stick, not true. You need to preheat your pan, then add oil, then cook. Just remember they need to have a lower temp than other pans. Do not overheat or they will stick. I cook oatmeal and can practically swish with water and they’re clean. Also a nice thing, they are all one piece on the bottom. They are completely encapsulated. I’ve seen all clad for 3x the price and the bottom has a seam that can eventually let water in. Don’t hesitate to get these. They are strong and will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for heavy use
customer_reviews.text: Looking for something reliable over the long haul without the risk of toxic non-stick coatings melting into the food. These are great, predictable heat pattern. Clean up is also easy, just some boiled water and everything loosens off of it. Would recommend to anyone cooking at home regularly for a family.
customer_reviews.author: R.Brad Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Nice pans, but NOT for fried eggs!
customer_reviews.text: Nice cookware set, but really not the pans to use for fried eggs in the morning - almost always stick — not worth the aggravation. You’ll need a non-stick pan. Oh, you can try “seasoning” the pan over and over, and adding just the right amount of oil/butter, and get it at the perfect temperature, and use another pan for bacon/sausage, then not wash it in soap or put in the dishwasher— and still have your breakfast eggs stick to the pan more often than not. But you will want another good old non-stick pan to pull out for fried eggs. These are nice looking pans though for almost everything else!
customer_reviews.author: Rick of Fredericksburg

customer_reviews.title: What Great Pans
customer_reviews.text: I decided on these because of a recommendation by America's Test Kitchen as the best "value option." I have not been disappointed. I've been shocked how non-stick and easy to clean they are. Plus is so great that you can put them in the dishwasher. They look good too. I'm not in love with the lid shapes, just because they're a little hard to store but that's really the only knock I've found on this set.
customer_reviews.author: Luke J. Tolley

customer_reviews.title: Best pans ever
customer_reviews.text: I was going back and forth between the T-fal stainless steel and the Cuisinart. There are a lot of reviews on both but what sold me on this set was just the reliability. From the research I did this set was extremely consistent and had very little warping when cared for properly. The biggest thing to avoid warping with stainless steel is letting it cool properly. I cannot count how many reviews have people using the pan on high heat on the stove and immediately cleaning it with cold water. That is just begging for warping. Overall I love this set and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Love my new pots and pans! I had non stick for over 7 years and the surface was scraping off. Upgraded to these and very happy! They cook well the only negative is when I use vegetable oil they get a residue that is really hard to get off. I use bar keepers friend and a scrubber to get it off. And it takes a while. So that part sucks, but other than that I haven’t had issues. If you use vinegar after cleaning then they stay shiny. They get water spots if you don’t use vinegar.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Function > looks
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for a few weeks now and I really like them however, theres some sort of cloudiness, or residue that I can't get off of the inside on the bottom no matter how much I scrub. Functionally, they're still great. Aesthetically, they're not looking as new as they should be. If you care about function over looks, these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Nice pans!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to purchase pans on Amazon because I’m not always sure of the quality, but the price was right and I am VERY happy with my purchase. I did a lot of research for stainless pans, and they’re fairly easy to clean if you heat them properly and use oil of some kind. When I do have things stick, I’ve done the boil method and that’s worked wonders. To shine them up I’ve been using Bar Keepers friend (and then washing again after) and that works REALLY well. Would recommend these pans, 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Kmat317

customer_reviews.title: Quality, durability, and performance
customer_reviews.text: These pans are great. I bought the set when we switched to an induction cooktop, and I couldn’t be happier. The pans feel sturdy. They do a good job of distributing the heat evenly. They aren’t non-stick, but food doesn’t really stick to them and they’re very easy to clean. After a year, these pans still look shiny and brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Kaillayna

customer_reviews.title: Caution
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had these pans for about 3 months now. They say to keep the heat lower because they distribute heat evenly and heat fast but that just doesn’t work. When you turn the heat up to high they burns everything that touches them. I was extremely disappointed in these. I must not that we have a ceramic range so maybe they will work better with gas. I had much better luck with the copper one as seen on TV. Just my two cents.
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but hard to cook with
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price of this set. I like the look of this set. I like the quality of this set. I just don’t think I like using stainless steel cookware. It is a struggle to keep things from sticking and burning while cooking. It’s even more of a struggle to clean after I’m done. From what I’ve read, this can be typical for this type of cookware. I guess I should have done a bit more research before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W

customer_reviews.title: It seems like it will last
customer_reviews.text: Before we got these we’d just buy whatever was on sale and didn't have terrible reviews and it’d last maybe a year or so. I’m not very educated on cook-ware, but these have been a good set in my opinion. I bake/cook nearly all of our meals and snacks and these are holding up well. I’ve noticed that I have to keep the temperature slightly lower than I’m used to and therefore let things cook a little longer. Also, I use a thicker layer of butter or oil because food is really hard to get off once it sticks. When it does stick I just let it soak with soapy water and scrape with a plastic spatula.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Durable, Even cooking (No Rusting)
customer_reviews.text: I have had this set for over 2 years and they are as durable and reliable as any pot or pan set for the money. I have seen many other reviews describing rusting or hard to clean and these comments in my mind are unaware how to use/clean stainless steel pots and pans. Steel pots and pans weren't made to be shinny all the time they are there to be derable, versitile and offer even cooking temps. This set does the job. Highly recommend for PROish home cooks
customer_reviews.author: mickey

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: These pans are made for some food to stick would not recommend for eggs unless throughly season pan atleast 6 or 7 times. With enough fat or butter nothing really sticks. Made caramel in the large skillet let pan soak in water for 3 hours and everything wiped out without soap. Would not recommend to anyone who isn't a serious cook too much maintenance will be needed. Quality is above price point. If you enjoy cooking and making pan sauces these pans are what your looking for if you only need cookware wouldnt reccomend
customer_reviews.author: ramon hislop

customer_reviews.title: Everything sticks
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why people gave this good reviews, you will be wasting your money. Made potatoes and eggs and they stuck to the pan so much ON LOW, it's impossible to get anything crispy or even cook it well for the matter. I don't know about you but when a pan is NOT non-stick it's a waste of money. I read all the reviews before buying and trusted the people that wrote good things but that was a mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Jamison Young

customer_reviews.title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!! EVERYTHING STICKS TO THE PANS !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Having owned this set for 6 months it is terrible unless you are boiling water! Don’t waste your money everything sticks to it ! What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Rusness

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty pans!
customer_reviews.text: These are not too heavy, have the hollow type handle that doesn't get too hot, and are reasonably easy to clean. Heat distribution is great, still learning how to gauge how hot things are. I like the stainless steel especially that it is insulated and keeps the aluminum core away from the food. This is my first time using non-non-stick pans. It's great they can go straight from the stove to the oven. The 10 piece set has just what I wanted without anything redundant. Note that the Tri-ply set has glass lids not metal (which I appreciate b/c not as heavy and can see how the food is doing).
customer_reviews.author: Kitkatkate

customer_reviews.title: The Jury Is Still Out
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never owned stainless steel pots and pans. This set was costly, and what I’m coming across is that the pans seem to be harder to clean than what I’ve had before (an anodized set). Don’t necessarily hate it, but don’t love it either.
customer_reviews.author: Marla

customer_reviews.title: Great pans. seriously
customer_reviews.text: Great pans. seriously. As a rule, keep your heat low because these will build up heat just fine at low temps. I usually burn things at a 4 (just below medium) on my gas stovetop. For example I'll cook eggs at a 2 on a gas burner, give it a second to heat up, light spritz of cooking oil and then the eggs and it'll stay nonstick nicely. If you use too much heat it'll cake. If you do cake or burn, nbd- let cool, then fill with water to let sit for a bit before scraping off with plastic scraper thing. Def. get the barkeeper soap because that'll shine them up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought right before Quarantine....
customer_reviews.text: Bought at the beginning of March 2020, and it’s seen non-stop use since. Quarantined with a family of 4, 99% have been made using this great set! So easy to clean, great heat distribution, even on my older glasstop. Replaced a 15 yr old way more expensive set, that set was never as good, even when I had gas. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this set. Had them for about a month now and they are wonderful. You do have to hand wash but it’s really easy. I did Have to purchase a non scratch stainless steel pot and pan cleaner for when I fry or cook certain things. It gets it perfectly clean and looks bran new again. Most other foods cooked in them just need simple soap and water. Absolutely worth the buy. They are heavy and you can definitely see and feel the quality. Just follow the care instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Shiloah Nicolay

customer_reviews.title: Look nice but seem cheaply made, disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Seems like they would get scratched up easily. Though the too-long pan handles are heat-resistant, lids are thin with non-heat-resistant handles. So I am returning. Thought to Google a couple of videos about how to choose cookware. Sets can contain pieces we rarely to never use, like smaller pots and pans. Think I will try larger individual pieces from Tramontina, made in Brazil, assembled in USA.
customer_reviews.author: P&J

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This cookware set is just so bad. They heat up so quick that burning food is a near guarantee. Not only that, but they will be stained after your first use and that’s WITHOUT burning any food on them. Utterly worthless. I have used cheap cookware from Walmart that is leaps and bounds better than these. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE STICKING
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible frying pans! Everything sticks! I like the pots, but that’s it! I want to return them, I paid for a set!!! Just awful
customer_reviews.author: Dan and Leisha Kinser

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: The pots are pans are wonderful. I notice such an improvement from my Caphalon pans. I do notice that if I use a little oil when cooking the food doesn't stick but it does leave a bit of a mess. However, they clean very well -with some good scrubbing and some Barkeeper's Friend. I do plan on buying a 12 inch skillet that is not included in this set! Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get too hot !
customer_reviews.text: Nice cookware learn to cook on other cheaper pans and burn them up first you don’t wanna cook with these with too high of heat stuff burns and sticks on pans and pans will discolor stuff sticks an they heat well and cook well and food doesn’t stick too bad if used properly and no Teflon that’s probably why your lookin at this type of cookware and it looks nice also with good weight
customer_reviews.author: TNinLP

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than you think
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my first home and bought this pot set because there were so many pieces and I thought that will be enough however I’m not good with dimensions so I went off the pics the pot set is much smaller than anticipated and I am unable to return it since I don’t live in the United States and the cost will not be worth it. I was sooo excited to receive this product but now I am very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Kerisha J.

customer_reviews.title: The Cuisinart Multiclad Pro Is BETTER than the All Clad Triple Ply
customer_reviews.text: I went to BB and B to compare the All Clad Triple Ply with this set. BB and B Had other sets from Cuisnart but not the Multiclad Pro. Now I see why....The Cuisinart Multiclad Pro Is BETTER and a side by side comparison would leave All Clad in the dust. The handles on the Cuisinart are much more comfortable and the thickness of the metal is the same as the All Clad. The Cuisinart Multiclad Pro Is BETTER! Ray
customer_reviews.author: Raymond C. Cuda

customer_reviews.title: Still impressed after 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these pots for more than 2 years and each day I am grateful that I made the investment to purchase the 12 piece set. Even after a few mishaps on my part that ended up in burnt meals the pots bare no evidence of this. A mixture of vinegar and baking soda works like a charm to remove any buildup and return the original shine.
customer_reviews.author: SRC

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.text: Going into this purchase I knew that this was more expensive than the regular cookware. While i knew not to expect it to be significantly better than the other stuff i have tried over time, i did expect it to be at least dishwasher safe in the short run. I just pulled out the pot after first wash in the dishwasher and it is all discolored and scratched from inside. Definitely not dishwasher safe as it claims to be. I regret this purchase and should have just gone with the cheaper stuff knowing that i wont really be able to use them in the dishwasher. I want to return this, but i didn't even keep the box around.
customer_reviews.author: Jaskirat

customer_reviews.title: It would be great for gas or regular electric cooking
customer_reviews.text: This cookware does not work properly on an induction cooktop. We have a new Jenn-Aire induction cooktop and when power is turned on the cookware makes a buzzing sound. From what I can research the triply construction vibrates with induction cooking. It would be great for gas or regular electric cooking. Cusinart customer care says they are unaware of the problem. The MCP-12N set is made in China while the Cuisinart Classic set is made in France and may or may not have the same problem. When you are on the bleeding edge of newer technology you bleed...
customer_reviews.author: Gregory J

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: unbelievable quality for the price. saw the all-clad at bed bath and beyond, but those are ridiculously expensive, even with the 20% off coupon i had about 30 of. almost bought em, but saw these when price checking on amazon while in the store. took a chance and ordered these instead on the spot. these things are fantastic. my wife has asaid after every meal shes made using these, it was the best tasting shes ever had. fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: matthew h shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on the different types of stainless cookware and finally settled on this set. I have had it now for a year and they are as good as new and look new. I use them every day and find that they cook evenly, on lower heat than I ever used before, clean up nicely and Barkeepers Friend is my new best friend. It keeps my pots and pans looking shiny and new and cleans up everything very easily. I would recommend this set to anyone who is looking for a quality stainless set of cookware.
customer_reviews.author: grannyb

customer_reviews.title: Really like this set of pans
customer_reviews.text: I love how these pans look but they are also super durable and easy to clean. At first it seemed like boiling water takes a bit longer with these pans compared to my last set but it’s a much more controlled boil and not bubbling all out of the pan and making a mess. And I know they are a healthier material to cook with so that’s an additional bonus.
customer_reviews.author: FNB

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and functional
customer_reviews.text: This set of cuisinart stainless is absolutely beautiful and cooking with it is a dream . The pans take somewhat longer to heat up but distribute the heat evenly throughout. The handles do not get too hot .Clean up is a breeze. I compared to multiple products on the market and this was the most affordable for the quality and also has highest ratings for durability. Am very pleased with the set
customer_reviews.author: Ndr

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pots, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviews, these are tremendous quality. Heavy steel. Heats very quickly. I am getting some discoloration at the bottom of some pots but that's probably user error as I don't fully know how to use them. But for what I want, a great set of pots and pans which heat evenly and quickly, these are GREAT. However, like some of echoed with eggs, eggs stick to the pans. Again, may be user error as I am probably not doing something right. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Ten

customer_reviews.title: High quality and very well made.
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderfully made set of stainless steel pans, a set to last a lifetime. Somewhat substantial in weight, sturdy, dependable. Usually soaking in soapy water and wiping clean works, sometimes for cooked on food it takes some dishwasher detergent or the special cleaner recommended. Metal utensils do scratch up the shiny finish, so order non-medal ones to use if you don’t have some already. Great price for this quality set of pots/pans! Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Flaherty

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. All foods stick. Terrible refund policy
customer_reviews.text: The food sticks to the pans. I tried to fry eggs over easy in olive oil and they stuck to the pan! I tried to fry hamburger and it stuck also! Very disappointed. We bought these in July and have emailed Cuisinart 3 times with the required information. They offered to replace them!! We made it clear that we wanted a refund and no response!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great price, Cuisinart quality
customer_reviews.text: I got this set for my sister after she just remodeled her kitchen, she's been wanting a nice set of stainless steel pots/pans for year. I actually wanted something a little more expensive, but not something in the All Clad range. After reading countless reviews, It seemed these outperformed sets costing substantially more. I did view a set locally for sale and was impressed. As far as the rating, the construction and materials rate 5 stars, but durability remains to be seen- so disregard the 5 stars there but the field required an input. They do have a lifetime warranty, but even that has caveats!
customer_reviews.author: Louis P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cookware
customer_reviews.text: Love this cookware. Bought it to replace old coated cookware so it took a little getting used to with the temperature, using scratch-resistant utensils & just the general use - advise to read the instructions for care & use - they are there for a reason. Cleaning is a little extra work for me because I like them looking nice but I use vinegar when needed & they clean up good. I feel they are a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Julie S.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with the quality of stainless steel. The coating is coming off just after single wash. I had bought this product after lot research. But it’s not worth it. Please look at other options if you considering to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Cooking is enjoyable again!
customer_reviews.text: Handled frying potatoes, steak and eggs very well. Just preheat and add a little lite olive oil. Nothing stuck and cleaned up with just some warm water, dish soap and a sponge. Some discoloration from high heat and scratching from using metal utensils is to be expected. But it’s a really enjoyable experience cooking with all metal pans and utensils. Allows you to just focus on the food and not have to worry about nonstick toxins from using high heat and scratching the nonstick coating. No more having to use nonmetal utensils and worrying about the plastic, wood or whatever other nonmetal utensils getting melted or burned. Cooking is fun with metal!
customer_reviews.author: Frank O

customer_reviews.title: Ok.... if you don’t use it
customer_reviews.text: Only used 2 or 3 times in first week owning it. Heating the pan on medium heat with oil while preparing the food.... like normal, it warped and burned the underside of the pan. Poor quality. Trying to find out how to do warranty claim it....
customer_reviews.author: Wesley L. Stanhope

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cooking eggs
customer_reviews.text: I thought this cookware set was great looking when I received them, looked high quality too. However the first thing I cooked on it was an egg, it stuck bad and was hard to get off. Disappointedly I tried cooking other things and the password great for everything else! I kept a nonstick pan from my old set to use for eggs. If you do cook eggs in these pans, you'll need to use lots and lots of butter or oil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing set, great value, easy clean up.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this set for a couple months now. I'm used to using cast iron, but I've been looking for a nice set to use on the stove and in the oven. Being able to put the pan in the oven was very important to me and this set fits the bill. I've cooked quiche, bone broth, eggs, burgers, soup, you name it. Stove top and oven use. Everything cooks evenly, and clean up is a breeze. I highly recommend the cuisinart pots and pan set.
customer_reviews.author: R Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality set
customer_reviews.text: Really nice set. Perfect weight to them, not too crazy heavy, but def not light and chincy either. Quality set, lids are nice. Very attractive. My first use, I made an egg, and it stuck horribly (my fault, never cooked on an electric stove in my life..lol) and the pan cleaned up incredibly easy. Used quite a few times, and they look great (I baby them though:)
customer_reviews.author: m.m.

customer_reviews.title: Get the pans
customer_reviews.text: Had these for about 6 mo now after a ton of research. I absolutely love them! Virtually nonstick (if someone tells you otherwise they’re using them wrong). Dishwasher cleans them for the most part- I’ll hand wash them every now and again with barkeepers friend to get any water spots off. Get the pans!!!
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cookset!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this cookset! I thought it was going to feel cheap and light since it wasn't the All-Clad, but it actually feels very heavy duty. I did notice that the stainless steel lids give off a metal smell when you cook with them. I wonder if the lids are a different composition of metal than the pots. Neither the pots or the pans give off this smell. Maybe we just need to scrub the lids thoroughly before we use them. [UPDATE]: We finally tried to use the 10 inch skillet, and noticed it was warped. It does not sit flat on our induction stove. We will be contacting customer service to see about a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: noesis

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious with lids.
customer_reviews.text: We really like this cookware. It is heavier than what we are used to and we like the "helper" handles on the large skillet. A big negative is the lids. When removing the lids from a pan/ pot you have two choices--having water drip on your stove/ counter or steam hitting your hand. I am not sure I would have bought this set if I had known about the lids.
customer_reviews.author: George Sadler

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these about a month ago and wanted to really try them out before writing a review. I really put them through the gauntlet too! Great pans, good weight and the handles aren't awkward. Had one problem where I ended up with a scorch mark (serves me right... walked away from the stove!) but my husband used the citrus cleaner we use on our stove top and it looks brand new! I even made the perfect omelet for the hubby with no cracks or breaks, just flipped it over and slid right out! I'm looking forward to many future meals with my cookware!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Gotta buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pans! Bought a set for my daughter and she loves them so I had to get! Also my previous pans were marketed as stainless but they failed the test. If a magnet sticks it's stainless which these cuisinart pans are. My old ones magnet did not stick anywhere. They do take a little bit to get used too, for they heat up quickly even on a low setting also food sticks but just add some coconut and or Olive oil or other healthy oil and your all set. Do recommend these pans, and also suggest you purchase bar keepers friend to help keep them looking brand new and to remove stuck on food.
customer_reviews.author: Sparrow

customer_reviews.title: Look great. Cook great.
customer_reviews.text: I like that these were $100 cheaper on Amazon than the identical brand & model online elsewhere. We've got a new induction cooktop so we needed them. The sizes do a good job of fitting all our needs; even got that one for steaming vegetables. They're a bit heavy but not a big deal. Heat distribution is fine. The handles are metal but barely heat up; no potholder needed for them so far. We're content!
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: If you are confused what to buy for your induction stove and don't want to break the bank BUY these!!!
customer_reviews.text: After needing to change my cookware after putting in an GE induction stove top. I was overwhelmed with all the things to look at in the needed cookware. I had always used nonstick and the leap to stainless induction cookware could be pricey. As much as I wanted the most expensive U.S brand I went with these from the ratings to make the transition to learn on. As I am a very impatient person and clean up has to be quick and easy for me. I am so happy I went with these. They feel and look high end and even sparked the interest of my hubby guy friends who usually could careless about pot and pan.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Morales

customer_reviews.title: Great general-use cookware at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this set. It conducts heat evenly and perfectly. It's easy to clean. If needed for major cleanup, just use Barkeeper's Friend to have your cookware looking like new. It doesn't weigh a ton, which I appreciate. I did buy an Anolon nonstick 8" skillet specifically for eggs, but that is the only supplemental piece I've needed so far. I will likely get a Dutch oven as well - but for the vast majority of my cooking needs, this set is fantastic. It cooks as well as a friend's much more expensive brand set, and is more than worth the very reasonable price
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to All-Clad
customer_reviews.text: If you can find this on sale, do not hesitate to pick it up. I was in a bind so I had to pay full price. Normally I hate paying full price for anything and can wait, but I needed some pots and pans for my new place and had to buy SOMETHING, so I went with this set. I'm happy I did. They are HEAVY and take a few minutes to heat. This is actually great, as it should be for high quality pots and pans. I don't have a single complaint.
customer_reviews.author: CalZona

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 4 years of daily use
customer_reviews.text: We've used this set daily for 4 years and it still looks brand new when we use beekeeper's friend. If anything burns onto the pan, we pour some very hot water and let it sit until the dishes need to be done. The food cooks evenly and you can get a great sear. The pots and pans are heavy, but it's well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: m'goats

customer_reviews.title: Okay but not WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Pans are nice design but would like bigger fry and sauté pans instead of the very small pans that come with the set-🙁 The pans cook evenly, but because of stainless steal can cook fast. Set is sturdy, however they DON’T clean easily even when using Bar Keepers powder. Good set for the price but I’m not in Love!
customer_reviews.author: JCOATES

customer_reviews.title: Great set that will last
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted a nice set of pots and pans and this set is the one. I was looking at All-Clad but was leary of spending the money. Love this set. Edges are rolled for easy pouring. Lids have a perfect fit. Takes so much less heat to achieve excellent results. Cons: Some of the bigger pans are rather heavy and takes some elbow grease to clean some of the time depending on what you are cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Edit: The frying pan has really sharp edges and unfortunately has cut our hands several times now, drawing blood. Wondering if it's a design flaw on this particular piece. Won't be cooking pancakes with these pans, but other than that, I love this set! They are a real beauty and cook quite well other than my pancake fiasco. That has been my only sticking issue. They clean well and can be put in the dish washer. I wanted a set that wouldn't peel off with toxic crud into my food. Wish it would have come with another smaller sauce pan but the other sizes were perfect. Need more to add to my collection!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne M.

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous Cookware Set
customer_reviews.text: We are completely overjoyed with this cookware set. It arrived carefully packaged. Each piece has a heft and weight to it and it's marvelous to use for cooking and cleans up beautifully. The lids are interchangeable so that all pieces have tops that fit well. We'll get a lot of use out of this product. Thank you to Cuisinart and to Amazon and their suppliers for a superb product!!! I could have spent this much on one or two pieces elsewhere, easily.
customer_reviews.author: Proceed to go

product_meta.title: Cuisinart MCP-12N Multiclad Pro Stainless Steel 12-Piece Cookware Set
product_meta.description: Size:12-PC Set| Design:Cookware SetThe kitchens of France were the inspiration behind the elegant Cuisinart MultiClad Pro Stainless Cookware collection. Cuisinart has included everything you need in this spectacular 12-piece set to perfectly perform all the basic cooking tasks, large or small. From reheating a single portion of soup to preparing appetizers, entrées and side dishes for the entire family, you?ll find every tool you need in this deluxe set. The line features an updated handle design for a more distinguished look. The new handles provide a modern and professional style while maintaining a comfortable and controlled grip. Features: Set includes|1.5 Quart saucepan with cover (|MCP19-16N)|3 Quart saucepan with cover (|MCP193-18N)|3.5 Quart sauté pan with helper handle and cover (|MCP33-24HN)|8 Quart stockpot with cover (|MCP66-24N)|8" skillet (|MCP22-20N)|10" skillet (|MCP22-24N)|20cm steamer insert with cover (MCP116-20N)|Professional Triple Ply Construction features a core of pure aluminum and a brushed stainless exterior.|Heat Surround™ Technology allows for even heat distribution along the bottom and sidewalls of the cookware.|Cool Grip™ Handle Solid stainless steel riveted handle stays cool on the stovetop.|Drip-Free Pouring Rim Tightfitting cover seals in moisture and nutrients for healthier more flavorful results every time you cook.|Dishwasher Safe|Lifetime Warranty|Suitable for use with induction cook tops
feature_bullets: Polished cooking surface does not discolor, react with food or alter flavors.

Cookware also features cool grip handles secured with stainless steel rivets and self-basting, tight fitting lids, Triple-Ply construction includes the unsurpassed heat conductivity of a pure aluminum core. It insures maximum heat retention and even heat distribution, eliminating hot spots
Oven safe up to 550F, Rims are tapered for drip-free pouring.
Dishwasher safe, Tight-fitting stainless steel covers seal in food's natural juices and nutrients for healthier, more flavorful results. Covers are dishwasher-safe

12-piece cookware set. The set consists of: 1-1/2- and 3-quart covered saucepans; 8- and 10-inch open skillets; 3-1/2-quart covered saute pan; 8-quart covered stockpot; steamer insert with lid. 12 pieces total..Professional Triple Ply Construction features a core of pure aluminum and a brushed stainless exterior
Suitable for use with induction cook tops
Drip-Free Pouring Rim Tightfitting cover seals in moisture and nutrients for healthier, more flavorful results, every time you cook

specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,494 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
